com.xhive.util.interfaces
Interface XhiveSqlLoaderIf

Deprecated. Use XhiveSQLDataLoaderIf or XhiveCSVFileLoaderIf instead 

public interface XhiveSqlLoaderIf

The XhiveSqlLoaderIf interface enables you to load non-XML data into a DOM tree.

The SQL loader interface accepts input from JDBC-compliant database drivers, and from files with a sequential structure (for example, a comma-separated file).

There are several parameters that influence the way the DOM tree is constructed:

Parameter Meaning Values
docCreator The DOMImplementation used.
jdbcdriver JDBC Driver.
user User name for connecting to the driver.
password Password for connecting to the driver.
url URL for the JDBC connection.
select SQL Select statement.
documentName Doc ID used with createDocument.
mode Column mode. XhiveSqlLoader.HEADER_TO_TAG: Header to tag,
XhiveSqlLoader.IGNORE_HEADER: Ignore header
rowElement Element name of a record.
colElementNames Element names of each column, use empty string for ignorable columns.
colIgnore Columns to ignore.
col2Attr Columns that should be an attribute. Element columns should have a "false" value in this array.
filename Filename to read, use import through a JDBC driver or a filename.
separator Separator character that separates fields within the input file.
escape Escape character for file input.
enclose Enclose character for enclosing strings within file input.
headersIncl Specifies whether headers are included, as the first record, when using file input.

Note: The parameter mode = HEADER_TO_TAG overrides the parameter colElementNames.

An instance of this interface can be acquired through com.xhive.XhiveDriverFactory.getDriver().getSqlLoader()

(c) X-Hive Corporation B.V. (www.x-hive.com)

loadSqlData

Document loadSqlData(DOMImplementation docCreator,
                     java.lang.String jdbcdriver,
                     java.lang.String user,
                     java.lang.String password,
                     java.lang.String url,
                     java.lang.String select)
Deprecated. Use XhiveSQLDataLoaderIf

Load SQL data from a JDBC driver.

Throws:
XhiveException.JDBC_CONNECT_ERROR - when the JDBC connection fails.
XhiveException.CLEAN_UP - when problems occur during closing of the JDBC connection.
XhiveException.SQL_EXCEPTION - when a database error occurred.
XhiveException.LOAD_ERROR - when a database error occurred.

Document loadSqlData(DOMImplementation docCreator,

                     char separator,
                     char escape,
                     char enclose,
                     boolean headersIncl,
                     java.lang.String documentName,
                     int mode)
Deprecated. Use XhiveSQLDataLoaderIf

Load SQL data from a file.

Throws:
XhiveException.CLEAN_UP - when problems occur during closing of files.
XhiveException.IO_ERROR - en error occurred while reading a file.
XhiveException.INVALID_INPUT_ERROR - when the headerIncl parameter is false and the mode is set to HEADER_TO_TAG.
